alert.note: Alert for Kauai East; Kohala; Koolau Windward (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued December 29 at 3:55PM HST until December 30 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR NORTH AND EAST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI MAUI AND THE BIG ISLAND... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR EAST AND WEST FACING SHORES EXPOSED TO THE NORTH SWELL... .Large north (010-020 deg) and northwest (320 deg) swells are combining to produce advisory level surf for north facing shores. The north swell has become dominant, allowed surf heights to lower for west facing shores and increase for exposed east facing shores through Saturday. The swell will slowly lower through Saturday evening, before a new large northwest swell fills in Saturday night. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Surf of 8 to 12 feet along east facing shores of Kauai and Oahu, and 10 to 15 feet along northerly exposures of leeward Big Island north of Keahole Point. * WHERE...East facing shores of Kauai and Oahu. Northerly exposures of leeward Big Island north of Keahole Point. * WHEN...Until 6 PM HST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Strong breaking waves and strong currents will make swimming dangerous.
info.instruction: Head all advice from ocean safety officials. When in doubt, don`t go out.
